Hi, Iâ€™m Sahana ðŸ‘‹

I am a Predoctoral Researcher at Google Research, India in the Advertising Sciences team. I recently graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, with a BTech in Electrical Engineering and an Interdisciplinary MTech in Data Science.

My research interests lie in applying machine learning and deep learning to solve NLP and multimodal problems. I am also highly interested in analyzing and incorporating interpretability in such systems. You can view my work on Google Scholar and Github.

You can contact me on Twitter, Linkedin, or by mail: sahanjich@gmail.com.

HintedBT - Augmenting Back-Translation with Quality and Transliteration Hints
Enabling effective usage of back-translation data for machine translation of low-resource, cross-script language pairs through hints/tags.
Technologies
nlp machine translation back-translation data augmentation low-resource cross-script tensorflow
Analyzing Interpretability of Deep RCQA Systems
Defining and analyzing the interpretability of four existing deep models (BERT, BiDAF, DCN, QANet) for the task of Reading Comprehension based Question Answering, on the dataset SQuAD.
Technologies
python nlp BERT interpretability integrated gradients tensorflow
Dialog-Based Image Retrieval
Implementing an novel, explainable system for dialog-based image retrieval, on the CLEVR-Dialog dataset.
Technologies
python multimodal scene graphs interpretability pytorch
